meanings.definition: A group of people appointed for a specific function, typically consisting of members of a larger group.
meanings.sent1: The school committees met to plan the upcoming event.
meanings.sent2: The committees in the company work together to make important decisions.
meanings.sent3: The committees argued over the best way to decorate the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The committees functioned like puzzle pieces, each fitting perfectly into the group.
meanings.sent5: The committees, with their diverse skills, were like a well-oiled machine.

meanings.definition: A group of people elected to manage the affairs of an organization.
meanings.sent1: The student committees were responsible for organizing school events.
meanings.sent2: The committees of the club held regular meetings to discuss finances.
meanings.sent3: The committees joked about who would be the best at handling the budget.
meanings.sent4: The committees were the captains steering the ship of the organization.
meanings.sent5: The committees were the backbone of the organization, keeping everything in order.
